Job Title: Geophysical Field Technician

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
At APTIM, we come to work each day knowing that we are making an impact on the world. Our work spans from safeguarding and maintaining critical infrastructure to helping communities recover from natural disasters, from empowering our armed forces and first responders to reducing carbon and energy use, and from making cities more resilient against the threats of climate change to restoring contaminated ecological systems.

Job Summary

APTIM currently has a career-growth opportunity for a Geophysicist to support near-surface site investigation and characterization activities at project locations throughout the United States, primarily as associated with the Military Munitions Response Program (MMRP). Typical tasks may include equipment calibration and troubleshooting, data acquisition, in-field processing, and report preparation. Strong interpersonal skills are a must, including the ability to communicate clearly and confidently, both written and verbally, to all project team members.

What You Can Expect From APTIM

 Work that is worthy of your time and talent Respect and flexibility to live a full life at work and at home Dogged determination to deliver for our clients and communities A voice in making our company better Investment into your personal and professional development

Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities

 Work collaboratively with Sr. Geophysicists on proposals; provide input on survey design and scope development. Field data acquisition utilizing various geophysical sensors including Metal-Mapper, APEX, UltraTEM, EM61, GPR and Magnetometers. Integration of geophysical sensors with positioning control systems including RTK GPS and SLAM. Assist with Site Logistics such as establishing field office and storage locations, test locations, and routes to work areas. Equipment maintenance, troubleshooting and testing. Ensures conformance to applicable codes and standards as well as company policies and procedures Applies education, knowledge, and skills to a wide range of standard and nonstandard situations Perform all assigned tasks in strict accordance with APTIM Safety Policies and Procedures Frequently support projects that require overnight travel of variable duration.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Geophysics or related field with 1-3 years' experience or Graduate of a DoD-approved UXO training course with minimum 5 years' relevant experience.Experience in Advanced Geophysical Classification (AGC) data acquisition and familiarity with data processing software (e.g., Oasis Montaj) a plus.Valid Driver's License with Clean Driving Record required.Possess or have ability to readily obtain OSHA HAZWOPER certification.Ability to perform physically demanding work in all types of terrain and weather, including wearing of proper PPE for work on hazardous waste sites.Amenable to frequent travel, including weekends, to meet project deadlines.

Who We Are And What We Do

APTIM is a global industry leader headquartered in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. With more than 4,000 employees worldwide, APTIM specializes in critical infrastructure, technical and data solutions, program management, environmental services, resilience, as well as sustainability and energy solutions. Our dedicated people have the proven experience and expertise to provide integrated services and solutions to government agencies, commercial, industrial, and energy customers. APTIM is committed to accelerating the transition toward a clean and efficient energy economy, building a sustainable future for our communities and the natural world, and creating an inclusive equitable environment that celebrates the diversity of our people.

Watch Our Video

Aptim Making a Difference

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
